name: Mexican-Style Deviled Eggs
author: Karen Armstead
summary: This recipe was given to me by a friend several years ago. These have a very unique flavor and are quite addicting. Garnish with chopped ripe olives or cilantro, and serve with your favorite salsa.
directions: Place the eggs into a saucepan in a single layer and fill with water to cover the eggs by 1 inch
Cover the saucepan and bring the water to a boil over high heat
Remove from the heat and let the eggs stand in the hot water for 15 minutes
Cool the eggs under cold running water
Halve the eggs lengthwise and scoop the yolks into a bowl
Mash the yolks with a fork
Stir the mayonnaise, chopped green chiles, olives, chili powder, and cayenne pepper until well combined; spoon into the egg white halves
